service_description: Cincinnati’s 24/7 HVAC lead desk. We match your emergency with a nearby, state-licensed, insured HVAC professional for fast furnace, AC, and heat pump repairs—serving Downtown, Over-the-Rhine, Hyde Park, Oakley, Clifton, Westwood, Anderson Township, and more.
hero_subheadline: A network of state-licensed HVAC professionals standing by 24/7 across Cincinnati and Hamilton County

service_features.title: Live Intake & Fast Matching
service_features.description: Call or book online—your request is routed to the nearest available pro for the fastest on-site arrival.

service_features.title: Licensed & Insured Pros
service_features.description: We connect you with Ohio-licensed contractors who carry required liability coverage for HVAC work [1][3].

service_features.title: Upfront Options
service_features.description: Your contractor provides clear diagnostics and repair options before work begins—no pressure, no surprises.

faq.question: Are you the HVAC contractor?
faq.answer: No—we’re a referral service. We connect you with independent, state-licensed HVAC professionals from our network for emergency repairs and service.

faq.question: Do you provide emergency HVAC repair in Cincinnati?
faq.answer: Yes. We route emergency calls across Cincinnati, Norwood, Hyde Park, Oakley, Clifton, Mt. Lookout, and surrounding neighborhoods 24/7.

faq.question: How soon can a technician arrive?
faq.answer: Arrival times depend on location, traffic, and availability. We prioritize no-heat and no-cool emergencies and match the nearest available pro.

faq.question: What HVAC brands do your network pros service?
faq.answer: Most major brands are supported, including Trane, Carrier, Lennox, Goodman, Rheem, and Daikin—residential and light commercial.

faq.question: Are the technicians licensed and insured?
faq.answer: Yes. We aim to connect you with OCILB-licensed contractors who meet Ohio’s insurance requirements for HVAC work [1][3].

faq.question: Are tax credits or rebates available?
faq.answer: Federal tax credits may be available in 2025 for qualifying high-efficiency equipment. Your contractor can advise based on your home and system [2].

faq.question: How does pricing work?
faq.answer: Pricing, estimates, and warranties are provided by the independent contractor. You’ll review and approve before any work begins.

testimonials.quote: They restored cooling to our downtown office before the workday ended—excellent communication and service!
Matched us with a tech fast. Our Oakley home was warm again the same evening with clear pricing.
